intro: Bulbocodium balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
